pdgm.pdgmnote: Beachy2005 Table 22. The imperative and jussive tenses form structurally distinct paradigms in the affirmative – juss:PNGProclitic + verbStem + ga;imprtv:verbStem + ŋ1 + num. In the negative both have the structure:PNGProclitic + verbStem + is. There is no polite form in the negative.

Beachy2005 Sect. 3.8.8-10. Dizi has a large number of non-mainClause morphological structures,which have in common the presence of a suffix (including the zero suffix –Ø) where a finite verb would have subject markers. (Note that some subordinate forms have the PNGProclitics.)

Beachy2005 Table 20. The imperative and jussive tenses form structurally distinct paradigms in the affirmative – juss:PNGProclitic + verbStem + ga;imprtv:verbStem + ŋ1 + num. In the negative both have the structure:PNGProclitic + verbStem + is. There is no polite form in the negative. The /g/ of ga is deleted after a consonant;the ŋ goes_to n after n,l and before t;ŋ goes_to m after labial (details in Table 21).

Beachy2005 Table 10 and 3.10. Main clause declatative negation consists of the negative auxiliary nan (var. na before 3sgm and 2sg,nɛ before suffixes beginning in –i-) with auxNegSuff,followed optionally by other sentence constituents,followed by tense-marked verb suffixed with -ti :nan + auxMNegSuff
Beachy2005 #3.8.2. The dervStem suffixes are added directly to the lexical root,before the tense-aspect markers.

Beachy2005 Table 20. The imperative and jussive tenses form structurally distinct paradigms in the affirmative – juss:PNGProclitic + verbStem + ga;imprtv:verbStem + ŋ1 + num. In the negative both have the structure:PNGProclitic + verbStem + is. There is no polite form in the negative. The /g/ of ga is deleted after a consonant;the ŋ goes_to n after n,l and before t;ŋ goes_to m after labial (details in Table 21).

Beachy2005 Table 22. The imperative and jussive tenses form structurally distinct paradigms in the affirmative – juss:PNGProclitic + verbStem + ga;imprtv:verbStem + ŋ1 + num. In the negative both have the structure:PNGProclitic + verbStem + is. There is no polite form in the negative.
Beachy2005 Table 19. Yes/no questions are formed:PNGProclitic[Table 10]+ verbStem + tense + interr (vs. non-interrog:verbStem + tense + subjSuff). Examples:3.8.6 (160)-(164).
